page.title: 08A FARM IN STAINFORTH (2)
page.content: Milking is done by machines, but they still need to be fixed onto the udders by hand. When being milked the cows stand above the farmer who is in a sort of pit. From here he is able to fit the machines onto the udders. The milking parlour is joined to a cow house and a silo. This is where the cows are housed and fed in winter. One full-time farm hand (male) is employed by the farmer. He lives nearby. Contractors are brought in to do the siloing, with some part-time helpers if necessary. All the family help on the farm and work together. Their home life is a close one. The majority of the house-work and meal preparation is done by the farmer's wife, and this is a very important part of keeping the farm going. The two daughters are expected to help, but the son is encouraged to help his dad.
